WELCOME TO E-TERRA

The programme aims to create effective awareness in various levels (of society)
to reduce the adverse impact on environment and health arising out of the polluting
technologies used in recycling e-waste in the unorganized sector.

Why E-Waste is harmful?

In the contemporary digital age, the rapid evolution of technology has led to a surge in electronic devices, contributing to a significant increase in electronic waste, or e-waste. E-waste comprises discarded electronic devices, ranging from smartphones and laptops to household appliances and industrial machinery. The harmful nature of e-waste emanates from its toxic components, including heavy metals like lead, mercury, and cadmium, as well as hazardous chemicals.

); } export default Body;
